column4: any solution to ubuntu not detecting usb drives? not even a line in dmesg when it is connected
sounds like the kernel module is not loading. Check lspci for your USB device then you need to load the correct module
nothing in lspci, and it all used to work fine until i upgraded to 10.x, im about to kick back to the 9.04 release
definitely sounds like a module issue. Any way you can reboot into a live cd or something and check the make and model of your device?
the main concern is an ectaco jetbook, i can get the model but it used to be detected
well im going to reinstall to an old 9.04 image, hopefully the devs figure out basic usb devices by the time 11.04 is out
I am wholly confident that a simple kernel downgrade would fix this for you should you not be happy about ascertaining and loading the module
i have been looking for and loading modules all day
ouch. Gotcha
the device shows up to all os's as a basic USB storage device
tho I have never been successful downgrading the kernel in a ubuntu install, could I really knock all the way down to last years kernel?

long shot, but you could try removing the device then: sudo rmmod option && sudo rmmod usb_storage - reload them and try the device again. Like I say, that is a long shot, though, as there would likely be evidence of -something- in your dmesg
I am having similar problems with a device myself and that method described above is while tempramental, does fix it sometimes
ERROR: Module option does not exist in /proc/modules
load it and try the device
also, check that usb_storage is being loaded
not a single line in dmesg
and a usb flash drive is loading perfectly
this doesnt make sense, i cant even find a single log that this device even exists
well im off to find a USB sd card reader, if i cant fix it i can work around it
thanks for trying
let me know how you get on with it? I am in the process of compiling a list of such devices
